snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey called for an end to Washington’s 40-year ban on crude oil exports and faster approval of natural gas pipelines between the United States and Mexico.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, speaking during trip to Mexico, lays out plan for what he calls a North American energy renaissance; calls for an end to 40-year ban on crude oil exports, faster approval of natural gas pipelines between the United States and Mexico, and construction of the Keystone XL pipeline from Canada to the Gulf Coast.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey called for an end to Washington’s 40-year ban on crude oil exports and faster approval of natural gas pipelines between the United States and Mexico.

headline.main: In Speech on Mexico Trip, Gov. Christie Lays Out Vision for Energy ‘Renaissance’
headline.print_headline: In Speech on Mexico Trip, Christie Lays Out Vision for Energy ‘Renaissance’
